1. Prepare SYBR-Grn I
Stain by completely thawing an
Aliquot of stock and diluting 1:20 with
Clean TE buffer.
2. Transfer 198 microliters of cells from culturing containers into a manufacturer-approved 96-well microtiter
Plate in a sterile hood.
Pipette 2 microliters of 1:20 SYBR-Grn I diluted stock into each well of the microtiter plate.
4. Cover the microtiter
Plate and let
Stain for 60 min. in the dark.
5. Make a worklist for acquiring data on the Guava, as described by the manufacturer.
6. Start the worklist and
Load the microtiter
Plate into the Guava, taking care that the
Adjust settings on the green channel to 716 volts with a thres

Hold of 8-10 and gating from just over 10 to just over 100.
  8.
Acquire data, consult log, and review the results.
Regate or
Dilute and re
Count any wells that were too concentrated, improperly stained, or dirty.
Transfer csv file from
Run to jump drive and copy to PC.
